humanitarian aid blocked from reaching rohingya refugees in myanmar: the united nations is growing increasingly concerned as humanitarian aid is being denied entry to areas where rohingya refugees are fleeing violence in myanmar. the government of myanmar has stated that the blockade is necessary due to concerns about security, but the u.n. believes that the real reason is to prevent evidence of human rights abuses from reaching the international community. the rohingya minority in myanmar has faced decades of discrimination and violence, with many fleeing to neighboring bangladesh in recent years.
